{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3565069,"name":"Question all assumptions, search for truth.","username":"celttechie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T01:13:11.560Z","cooked":"

We have commands to move our elevator, shoulder, and arm subsystems to various positions to reach the different levels of the reef. We have a single button on the driver controller mapped to run the command sequence, and our operator has buttons to specify which positions to use for the various levels. So our command factory gets the positions from an attribute and returns a command sequence to move all 3 subsystems. This works for a while, but eventually it stops working and never comes back until we restart the code. In our matches it can occur after a few times of moving to a position, or it can go nearly the whole match without “locking up”. The stranger thing is that there are a couple of other buttons mapped to other more explicit command sequences for the same subsystems that always work. The difference is the positions are always static for each subsystem.

On top of that, I put each of the subsystems on SmartDashboard to watch their running command and used AdvantageScope to watch in realtime when the systems get commands. For the command sequence that moves to varying positions based on what the operator chose I never see the subsystem get the command, even when the subsystems are actually moving correctly. For the command sequence that has static positions for each of the subsystems I always see the commands given to the subsystems.

I kept trying to find if some other command was interrupting the command, or if we weren’t hitting some of our positions, but I can find nothing interfering. Does anyone have ideas about what may be happening?

Here’s the command that will eventually fail and never work again:

github.com

FROG3160/2025-reefscape/blob/46b415c7b019408aca9f5eb01bcaa27e223167e0/roborio/robotcontainer.py#L269


      
    
          
  1. def move_to_station(self) -> Command:
    2. 
          
  2.     return (
    3. 
          
  3.         self.arm.move(0)
    4. 
          
  4.         .andThen(self.shoulder.move(-0.2))
    5. 
          
  5.         .alongWith(self.elevator.move(10))
    6. 
          
  6.     )
    7. 
          
  7. 
          
  8. def hold_algae_during_travel(self) -> Command:
    9. 
          
  9.     return self.arm.move(0).alongWith(self.shoulder.move(-0.15))
    10. 
          
  10. 
          
  11. def move_to_position(self) -> Command:
    12. 
          
  12. 
          
  13.     first_shoulder_pos = self.scoringConfig.shoulder_start_pos
    14. 
          
  14.     elevator_pos = self.scoringConfig.elevator_pos
    15. 
          
  15.     second_shoulder_pos = self.scoringConfig.shoulder_end_pos
    16. 
          
  16.     arm_pos = self.scoringConfig.arm_pos
    17. 
          
  17. 
          
  18.     return (
    19. 
          
  19.         self.shoulder.move(first_shoulder_pos)
    20. 
          
  20.         .andThen(waitUntil(lambda: self.shoulder.at_position(first_shoulder_pos)))
    21. 
          
  21.         .andThen(self.elevator.move(elevator_pos))
    22.

And here’s a static sequence that always works:

FROG3160/2025-reefscape/blob/46b415c7b019408aca9f5eb01bcaa27e223167e0/roborio/robotcontainer.py#L250

    2. 
          
  2.     )
    3. 
          
  3. 
          
  4. def hold_coral_during_travel(self) -> Command:
    5. 
          
  5.     return (
    6. 
          
  6.         self.grabber.run_motor(0)
    7. 
          
  7.         .andThen(self.arm.move(0))
    8. 
          
  8.         .alongWith(self.shoulder.move(-0.2))
    9. 
          
  9.     )
    10. 
          
  10. 
          
  11. def move_to_home(self) -> Command:
    12. 
          
  12.     return (
    13. 
          
  13.         self.grabber.stop_motor()
    14. 
          
  14.         .andThen(self.arm.move(0))
    15. 
          
  15.         .andThen(waitUntil(self.arm.at_home))
    16. 
          
  16.         .andThen(self.elevator.move(0))
    17. 
          
  17.         .alongWith(self.shoulder.move(-0.2))
    18. 
          
  18.     )
    19. 
          
  19. 
          
  20. def move_to_station(self) -> Command:
    21.
